verses.verse: Hear<WH238> my teaching,<WH8451> my people.<WH5971> Turn<WH5186> your ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of my mouth.<WH6310>
I will open<WH6605> my mouth<WH6310> in a parable.<WH4912> I will utter<WH5042> dark sayings<WH2420> of old,<WH6924>
Which we have heard<WH8085> and known,<WH3045> and our fathers<WH1> have told us.<WH5608>

We will not hide<WH3582> them from their children,<WH1121> telling<WH5608> to the generation<WH1755> to come<WH314> the praises<WH8416> of Yahweh,<WH3068> his strength,<WH5807> and his wondrous works<WH6381> that he has done.<WH6213>

For he established<WH6965> a testimony<WH5715> in Jacob,<WH3290> and appointed<WH7760> a teaching<WH8451> in Israel,<WH3478> which he commanded<WH6680> our fathers,<WH1> that they should make them known<WH3045> to their children;<WH1121>
that the generation<WH1755> to come<WH314> might know,<WH3045> even the children<WH1121> who should be born;<WH3205> who should arise<WH6965> and tell<WH5608> their children,<WH1121>
that they might set<WH7760> their hope<WH3689> in God,<WH430> and not forget<WH7911> the works<WH4611> of God,<WH410> but keep<WH5341> his commandments,<WH4687>

and might not be as their fathers,<WH1> a stubborn<WH5637> and rebellious<WH4784> generation,<WH1755> a generation<WH1755> that didn't<WH3559> make their hearts<WH3820> loyal,<WH3559> whose spirit<WH7307> was not steadfast<WH539> with God.<WH410>
The children<WH1121> of Ephraim,<WH669> being armed<WH5401> and carrying<WH7411> bows,<WH7198> turned back<WH2015> in the day<WH3117> of battle.<WH7128>
They didn't<WH8104> keep God<WH430>'s covenant,<WH1285> and refused<WH3985> to walk<WH3212> in his law.<WH8451>
They forgot<WH7911> his doings,<WH5949> his wondrous works<WH5949> that he had shown them.<WH7200>
He did<WH6213> marvelous things<WH6382> in the sight<WH5048> of their fathers,<WH1> in the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> in the field<WH7704> of Zoan.<WH6814>
He split<WH1234> the sea,<WH3220> and caused them to pass through.<WH5674> He made the waters<WH4325> stand<WH5324> as a heap.<WH5067>
In the daytime<WH3119> he also led<WH5148> them with a cloud,<WH6051> and all night<WH3915> with a light<WH216> of fire.<WH784>
He split<WH1234> rocks<WH6697> in the wilderness,<WH4057> and gave them drink<WH8248> abundantly as out of the<WH7227> depths.<WH8415>
He brought<WH3318> streams<WH5140> also out of the rock,<WH5553> and caused waters<WH4325> to run down<WH3381> like rivers.<WH5104>
Yet they still<WH3254> went on to sin<WH2398> against him,<WH4784> to rebel against the Most High<WH5945> in the desert.<WH6723>
They tempted<WH5254> God<WH410> in their heart<WH3824> by asking<WH7592> food<WH400> according to their desire.<WH5315>
Yes,<WH1696> they spoke against God.<WH430> They said,<WH1696> "Can<WH3201> God<WH410> prepare<WH6186> a table<WH7979> in the wilderness?<WH4057>

Behold,<WH5221> he struck the rock,<WH6697> so that waters<WH4325> gushed out,<WH2100> and streams<WH5158> overflowed.<WH7857> Can<WH3201> he give<WH5414> bread<WH3899> also?<WH3201> Will he provide<WH3559> flesh<WH7607> for his people?<WH5971>"
Therefore Yahweh<WH3068> heard,<WH8085> and was angry.<WH5674> A fire<WH784> was kindled<WH5400> against Jacob,<WH3290> anger<WH639> also went up<WH5927> against Israel,<WH3478>
because they didn't<WH539> believe in God,<WH430> and didn't<WH982> trust in his salvation.<WH3444>
Yet he commanded<WH6680> the skies<WH7834> above,<WH4605> and opened<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of heaven.<WH8064>
He rained down<WH4305> manna<WH4478> on them to eat,<WH398> and gave<WH5414> them food<WH1715> from the sky.<WH8064>
Man<WH376> ate<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of angels.<WH47> He sent<WH7971> them food<WH3899> to the full.<WH7648>
He caused the east wind<WH6921> to blow<WH5265> in the sky.<WH8064> By his power<WH5797> he guided<WH5090> the south wind.<WH8486>
He rained<WH4305> also flesh<WH7607> on them as the dust;<WH6083> winged<WH3671> birds<WH5775> as the sand<WH2344> of the seas.<WH3220>
He let them fall<WH5307> in the midst<WH7130> of their camp,<WH4264> around<WH5439> their habitations.<WH4908>
So they ate,<WH398> and were well<WH3966> filled.<WH7646> He gave<WH935> them their own desire.<WH8378>
They didn't<WH2114> turn from their cravings.<WH8378> Their food<WH400> was yet in their mouths,<WH6310>
when the anger<WH639> of God<WH430> went<WH5927> up against them,<WH2026> killed some of their fattest,<WH4924> and struck down<WH3766> the young<WH970> men of Israel.<WH3478>
For all this they still sinned,<WH2398> and didn't<WH539> believe in his wondrous works.<WH6381>
Therefore he consumed<WH3615> their days<WH3117> in vanity,<WH1892> and their years<WH8141> in terror.<WH928>
When he killed<WH2026> them,<WH1875> then they inquired after him.<WH7725> They returned and sought God<WH410> earnestly.<WH7836>
They remembered<WH2142> that God<WH430> was their rock,<WH6697> the Most High<WH5945> God,<WH410> their redeemer.<WH1350>
But they flattered<WH6601> him with their mouth,<WH6310> and lied<WH3576> to him with their tongue.<WH3956>
For their heart<WH3820> was not right<WH3559> with him,<WH539> neither were they faithful in his covenant.<WH1285>

But he,<WH7349> being merciful, forgave<WH3722> iniquity,<WH5771> and didn't<WH7843> destroy them.<WH7235> Yes, many times he turned<WH7725> his anger<WH639> away,<WH7725> and didn't<WH5782> stir up all his wrath.<WH2534>
He remembered<WH2142> that they were but flesh,<WH1320> a wind<WH7307> that passes away,<WH1980> and doesn't<WH7725> come again.
How<WH4100> often they rebelled<WH4784> against him in the wilderness,<WH4057> and grieved<WH6087> him in the desert!<WH3452>
They turned<WH7725> again and tempted<WH5254> God,<WH410> and provoked<WH8428> the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>
They didn't<WH2142> remember his hand,<WH3027> nor the day<WH3117> when he redeemed<WH6299> them from the adversary;<WH6862>
how he set<WH7760> his signs<WH226> in Egypt,<WH4714> his wonders<WH226> in the field<WH7704> of Zoan,<WH6814>
he turned<WH2015> their rivers<WH2975> into blood,<WH1818> and their streams,<WH2975> so that they could not drink.<WH8354>
He sent<WH7971> among them swarms of flies,<WH6157> which devoured<WH398> them;<WH6854> and frogs, which destroyed them.<WH7843>
He gave<WH5414> also their increase<WH2981> to the caterpillar,<WH2625> and their labor<WH3018> to the locust.<WH697>
He destroyed<WH2026> their vines<WH1612> with hail,<WH1259> their sycamore fig trees<WH8256> with frost.<WH2602>
He gave over<WH5462> their livestock<WH1165> also to the hail,<WH1259> and their flocks<WH4735> to hot thunderbolts.<WH7565>
He threw<WH7971> on them the fierceness<WH2740> of his anger,<WH639> wrath,<WH5678> indignation,<WH2195> and trouble,<WH6869> and a band<WH4917> of angels<WH4397> of evil.<WH7451>
He made<WH6424> a path<WH5410> for his anger.<WH639> He didn't<WH2820> spare their soul<WH5315> from death,<WH4194> but gave<WH5462> their life<WH2416> over<WH5462> to the pestilence,<WH1698>
and struck<WH5221> all the firstborn<WH1060> in Egypt,<WH4714> the chief<WH7225> of their strength<WH202> in the tents<WH168> of Ham.<WH2526>
But he led forth<WH5265> his own people<WH5971> like sheep,<WH6629> and guided<WH5090> them in the wilderness<WH4057> like a flock.<WH5739>
He led<WH5148> them safely,<WH983> so that they weren't<WH6342> afraid, but the sea<WH3220> overwhelmed<WH3680> their enemies.<WH341>
He brought<WH935> them to the border<WH1366> of his sanctuary,<WH6944> to this mountain,<WH2022> which his right hand<WH3225> had taken.<WH7069>

He also drove out<WH1644> the nations<WH1471> before<WH6440> them,<WH5307> allotted them for an inheritance<WH5159> by line,<WH2256> and made the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to dwell<WH7931> in their tents.<WH168>
Yet they tempted<WH5254> and rebelled<WH4784> against the Most High<WH5945> God,<WH430> and didn't<WH8104> keep his testimonies;<WH5713>
but turned back,<WH5472> and dealt treacherously<WH898> like their fathers.<WH1> They were turned aside<WH2015> like a deceitful<WH7423> bow.<WH7198>
For they provoked him to anger<WH3707> with their high places,<WH1116> and moved him to jealousy<WH7065> with their engraved images.<WH6456>
When God<WH430> heard<WH8085> this,<WH5674> he was angry, and greatly<WH3966> abhorred<WH3988> Israel;<WH3478>
So that he forsook<WH5203> the tent<WH4908> of Shiloh,<WH7887> the tent<WH4908> which he placed<WH7931> among men;<WH120>
and delivered<WH5414> his strength<WH5797> into captivity,<WH7628> his glory<WH8597> into the adversary<WH6862>'s hand.<WH3027>
He also gave<WH5462> his people<WH5971> over<WH5462> to the sword,<WH2719> and was angry<WH5674> with his inheritance.<WH5159>
Fire<WH784> devoured<WH398> their young men.<WH970> Their virgins<WH1330> had no wedding song.<WH1984>
Their priests<WH3548> fell<WH5307> by the sword,<WH2719> and their widows<WH490> couldn't<WH1058> weep.
Then the Lord<WH136> awakened<WH3364> as one out of sleep,<WH3463> like a mighty man<WH1368> who shouts<WH7442> by reason of wine.<WH3196>
He struck<WH5221> his adversaries<WH6862> backward.<WH268> He put<WH5414> them to a perpetual<WH5769> reproach.<WH2781>
Moreover he rejected<WH3988> the tent<WH168> of Joseph,<WH3130> and didn't<WH977> choose the tribe<WH7626> of Ephraim,<WH669>
But chose<WH977> the tribe<WH7626> of Judah,<WH3063> Mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> which he loved.<WH157>
He built<WH1129> his sanctuary<WH4720> like the heights,<WH7311> like the earth<WH776> which he has established<WH3245> forever.<WH5769>
He also chose<WH977> David<WH1732> his servant,<WH5650> and took<WH3947> him from the sheepfolds;<WH4356>
from following<WH310> the ewes that have their young,<WH5763> he brought<WH935> him to be the shepherd<WH7462> of Jacob,<WH3290> his people,<WH5971> and Israel,<WH3478> his inheritance.<WH5159>
So he was their shepherd<WH7462> according to the integrity<WH8537> of his heart,<WH3824> and guided<WH5148> them by the skillfulness<WH8394> of his hands.<WH3709>
